snippet: The parent company of Burger King and Tim Hortons reported a quarterly loss on Tuesday, hurt by costs related to the deal to combine the two chains.
abstract: Restaurant Brands International reports quarterly loss of $514.2 million, or $2.52 a share, down from profit of $66.8 million, or 19 cents a share, in year-earlier period; cites cost related to deal combining Burger King and Tim Hortons.
lead_paragraph: The parent company of Burger King and Tim Hortons reported a quarterly loss on Tuesday, hurt by costs related to the deal to combine the two chains.

headline.main: Restaurant Brands’ Profit Drops on Merger Costs
headline.print_headline: Restaurant Brands’ Profit Drops on Merger Costs
